results.title: His Girl Friday (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Cary Grant is the cheeky news editor, Rosalind Russell is the ace female reporter with printer’s ink in her veins. Amid the frenzy of newsmen competing for that front page story, high energy romance, and Ben Hecht’s famous overlapping dialogue and machine-gun paced script, a reporter about to get married and escape the newsworld, stumbles upon the biggest story of her career - a notorious criminal surrenders personally. One of the funniest and most biting screwball comedies on film. Also stars Ralph Bellamy. Based on the 1928 play “The Front page” by Ben Hecht and Charles MacArthur and a remake of the 1931 Howard Hughes film “The Front page”.

results.title: His Girl Friday
results.brief_description: Hildy, the journalist former wife of newspaper editor Walter Burns, visits his office to inform him that she’s engaged and will be getting remarried the next day. Walter can’t let that happen and frames her fiancé to keep her in her job.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

results.description: Hildy, the journalist former wife of newspaper editor Walter Burns, visits his office to inform him that she’s engaged and will be getting remarried the next day. Walter can’t let that happen and frames the fiancé, Bruce Baldwin, for one thing after another, to keep him temporarily held in prison, while trying to steer Hildy into returning to her old job as his employee.
description_for_label: Hildy, the journalist former wife of newspaper editor Walter Burns, visits his office to inform him that she’s engaged and will be getting remarried the next day. Walter can’t let that happen and frames the fiancé, Bruce Baldwin, for one thing after another, to keep him temporarily held in prison, while trying to steer Hildy into returning to her old job as his employee.

results.title: His first climb
results.brief_description: Begins by showing basic climbing equipment, including boots, helmet, carabiner, chocks and ropes. Shows techniques such as the use of ropes, specific knots and the running relay. Stresses the need for three-point contact with rockface at all times and the necessity for an experienced instructor.

results.title: His Dark Materials
results.brief_description: Follows the adventures of Lyra, an orphan who lives in a parallel universe in which science, theology and magic are entwined.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

results.description: Lyra is an orphan who lives in a parallel universe in which science, theology and magic are entwined. Lyra’s search for a kidnapped friend uncovers a sinister plot involving stolen children, and turns into a quest to understand a mysterious phenomenon called Dust. She is later joined on her journey by Will, a boy who possesses a knife that can cut windows between worlds. As Lyra learns the truth about her parents and her prophesied destiny, the two young people are caught up in a war against celestial powers that ranges across many worlds.
description_for_label: Lyra is an orphan who lives in a parallel universe in which science, theology and magic are entwined. Lyra’s search for a kidnapped friend uncovers a sinister plot involving stolen children, and turns into a quest to understand a mysterious phenomenon called Dust. She is later joined on her journey by Will, a boy who possesses a knife that can cut windows between worlds. As Lyra learns the truth about her parents and her prophesied destiny, the two young people are caught up in a war against celestial powers that ranges across many worlds.

results.title: Hiroyuki Iwaki
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Personalities of Today”.
Shows day to day life of renowned Japanese conductor, Hiroyuki Iwaki as he is interviewed by music critic, Marcel Grily. Includes background scenes of city/country life in Japan and also shows Iwaki conducting in various European cities. Features the NHK Symphony Orchestra, Tokyo.

results.title: Hiroshima: blast effect, April 1946 [Silent]
results.creator_credit: United States. National Archives and Records Service
results.brief_description: Filmed eight months after the dropping of the first atomic bomb. Shows the extent of the devastation caused by the bomb. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
